items.headline: I invested $200K in my daughter’s 529 plan. She doesn’t want to go to college. What should I do with this money?
items.summary_en: “Are there any other ways I can consider transferring the wealth to her?”

items.headline: Novo Nordisk downgrades sales outlook again amid bidding war with Pfizer for Metsera
items.summary_en: Management lowers full-year guidance, warns about competition, launches bid for Metsera.

items.headline: ‘It’s survival math every month’: The rent crisis that got Zohran Mamdani elected goes far beyond New York City
items.summary_en: The mayor-elect built his campaign around rent affordability. But the same issue applies across the country, according to experts — and the many people struggling to pay their rent each month.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: My father’s estate was awarded $50K in a class-action lawsuit. My brother, as executor, kept the money. What can we do?
items.summary_en: “My brother retains the money awarded to my father to this day. My mom is still alive.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Cava trims sales outlook amid heavy competition. But it’s wary of diving into the discounting fray.
items.summary_en: Mediterranean fast-casual chain Cava Group reported third-quarter results that missed Wall Street’s estimates, as younger and middle-income consumers struggle with higher costs and competition remains stiff.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Rivian rides expiring EV credits to a revenue beat, and its stock moves higher
items.summary_en: The electric-vehicle maker expects its third-quarter delivery performance to be its best of the year.

items.headline: Here’s how Pinterest’s holiday quarter just became a worry for Wall Street
items.summary_en: Pinterest’s stock drops about 20% on weaker revenue forecast for the shopping-heavy holiday quarter, usually the social-media company’s strongest.

items.headline: My girlfriend, a widow in her 40s, pays off her credit card after every transaction. Is that weird?
items.summary_en: “I saw her transfer $150 after we were done shopping.”

items.headline: Stadiums, shows abroad keep Live Nation upbeat on next year after sales miss expectations
items.summary_en: Live Nation Entertainment said concert demand is set to stay strong into next year, helped by shows abroad and concerts at its biggest venues. However, the Ticketmaster parent company’s third-quarter sales came up short of Wall Street’s expectations.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Why Super Micro’s stock is falling after earnings — even as guidance moves higher
items.summary_en: Super Micro continued to exhibit margin pressure in the latest quarter, reflecting a competitive server market.
